comment: UPDATE: After months of performing flawlessly, since the last update, none of my flows are working any more. They're fine if i manually 'Execute' them, but they're no longer firing automatically.  PREVIOUS: I wanted to create a simple script which would set my phone's screen lock to use a PIN when I was at home and a password  when I was elsewhere. Having previously tried Tasker and Automate; both of which seemed only to offer the option to enable/disable screen locking entirely, I didn't hold out much hope for this lesser known alternative. But the reviews were encouraging and I thought I'd give it a go. 15 mins later and *Hooray!* I now have a phone which uses a simple PIN no. at home (I still want some privacy!) and automatically switches to a stronger password when I'm away from home. UPDATE: I reinstalled the Qpython plugin and Automagic picked it up the second time. So all good now and another star added.

reply.author: Gridvision Engineering GmbH
reply.content:
Hi,

Please ensure that Automagic is allowed to run in the background and that the status icon is displayed so the system does not stop Automagic. Also check that no task killers are running. Also restart the device once.
Please contact me at info@automagic4android.com if the problem should persist.

Regards,
Martin

comment: Really great app. Using it with mi band tools, sleep as Android and DI.fm radio.    I have created 3 pretty involved flows. One that watches sleep as Android sleep start. author: Sean Ellis
comment: I feel the need to come back and revise my previous review. This is a fantastic alternative to Tasker, I may even say better in some ways. I've recently converted almost all of my tasks over and deleted Tasker along with the several plugins I had installed for it - since most of what I needed the plugins for is actually baked in to this app already... Tasker had been starting to act weird for me so I decided to give Automagic another go before I look at other alternatives. It took a little getting used to, some of the ways you have to do things is imo not very intuitive - but once you figure it out you just know and it becomes natural. It is actually really awesome, low footprint and much prettier layout if you're into that kind of thing. The scripting is very powerful and enjoyable to use. Though I do stand by what I said about support being practically non existent - when I run into problems, I want to do a Google search, get a little insight into how to achieve what I want to - learn something along the way and carry on. I don't want to have to email the developer directly and wait whoever knows how long for a reply. You probably get thousands of emails a day, I shouldn't have to be bothering you with that kind of stuff - but like I said - information is scarce. The forum is closed off, new registrations need to be approved or something before you can even post - so have to wait to even be able to ask a question to begin with at the official source of help. The subreddit is an absolute ghost town - almost all threads remain unanswered there. Google+, I don't really see anything here. There's maybe 2 communities - and one of them is Italian so I can't use that. I almost settled on the 4 stars because of this - but I'm enjoying it a lot and it seems very reliable so in terms of such a robust app with limitless possibilities it is definitely 5 star. I just wish there was better information out there. Nobody seems to know what Automagic is - and that is a damn shame.

reply.author: Gridvision Engineering GmbH
reply.content:
Hi,

That's not really accurate. You can get support by mail at info@automagic4android.com or in the support forum.
I also grant refunds outside of the regular Google Play refund time window, you just have to ask.

Regards,
Martin
